summary: This document is an email chain between a NY CART Coordinator/Senior Forensic Examiner and a representative from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding the processing and tracking of digital evidence (hard drives, iPads, laptops, desktops) seized in the Epstein case. It involves clarifying device inventory numbers and the status of forensic extraction.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: The individual is communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office about the processing of digital evidence, correcting a device identifier, and discussing the status of forensic extractions.

persons.name: OriirnMai
persons.context: The individual is following up on a prior call and list of devices, asking for clarification on discrepancies in the evidence spreadsheet and the expected delivery schedule.

connections.person1: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: They are corresponding professionally regarding the forensic processing and transfer of digital evidence for the Epstein case.

events.title: Email clarification on evidence devices
events.description: The NY CART Coordinator corrects a prior communication, stating that device NYC024392 was a 500GB hard drive that was processed, and clarifies that the iPad in question was NYC024359.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

events.title: Initial evidence spreadsheet sent
events.description: The NY CART Coordinator sent a spreadsheet detailing seized digital devices to the U.S. Attorney's Office, noting most items were at the Southern District and a few remained to be processed.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

locations: Southern District (likely Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The communication involves tracking and clarifying the forensic processing of multiple digital devices (hard drives, iPads, laptops, desktops) seized in the Epstein investigation, identified by NYC evidence numbers.
A specific correction is made: device NYC024392 was a 500GB hard drive that was processed, not an iPad; the iPad in question was NYC024359.
The U.S. Attorney's Office is inquiring about discrepancies in the evidence spreadsheet, specifically regarding device NYC024328 which was not listed, and the status of NYC024392.
The forensic examiner indicates that most evidence has been transferred to the Southern District, with a laptop and two desktops remaining to be processed, which may take time due to their size.
